name: Dungeons & Dragons (2024 Revised 5e)
description: The modern refined standard of 5e, streamlining class features and integrating digital-first design principles.

name: Dungeons & Dragons (5e 2014)
description: The blockbuster edition that brought TTRPGs to the mainstream, known for the Advantage/Disadvantage system and accessibility.

name: Dungeons & Dragons (4e)
description: A highly tactical, grid-focused edition that treated every class with a 'power' system similar to MMO cooldowns.

name: Dungeons & Dragons (v3.5)
description: The 'high crunch' era of d20 gaming, famous for endless prestige classes, feats, and the Open Game License explosion.

name: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (2e)
description: The 90s era of legendary campaign settings like Planescape and Dark Sun; it cleaned up 1e and introduced 'kits'.

name: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1e)
description: Gary Gygax’s definitive unified ruleset; the foundation of the 'Gygaxian' dungeon crawl with high lethality.

name: Dungeons & Dragons (Basic/Expert/BECMI)
description: The 'Classic' branch of D&D where Race was your Class (e.g., you played an 'Elf') and rules were simpler than AD&D.

name: Original Dungeons & Dragons (1974)
description: The three original brown booklets that started the hobby, requiring the 'Chainmail' wargame for combat rules.

name: Pathfinder (2e Remaster)
description: The 2024/2025 update that removed D&D-specific terminology and Alignment to become a fully independent system.

name: Pathfinder (2e)
description: The 2019 launch of the three-action economy, focusing on tight math, balanced encounters, and deep customization.

name: Pathfinder (1e)
description: Known as 'D&D 3.75,' this system took the 3.5e rules and expanded them into a massive, decade-long library of options.

name: Call of Cthulhu (7e)
description: A d100-based horror system where players investigate cosmic mysteries while managing their character's dwindling sanity.

name: Daggerheart (1e)
description: Darrington Press’s narrative-forward system using a 2d12 'Duality' mechanic to balance story outcomes between Hope and Fear.

name: Cyberpunk RED (Current Edition)
description: A gritty, high-stakes game of survival in a neon-drenched future where 'style over substance' and lethal combat are law.

name: Vampire: The Masquerade (5e)
description: A game of personal and political horror where players struggle with their inner beast and the complex social web of the Kindred.

name: Shadowdark (1e)
description: A minimalist 'Old School' fantasy game that prioritizes fast-paced dungeon crawling and real-time torch management.

name: Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay (5e)
description: A grim and perilous system where players take on mundane professions to survive a world of chaos, corruption, and dark humor.

name: Starfinder (2e)
description: A science-fantasy overhaul built on the Pathfinder 2e engine, bringing high-tech gear and starship combat into a cohesive tactical framework.

name: The One Ring (2e)
description: An evocative adaptation of Tolkien's Middle-earth that focuses on the themes of travel, shadow, and the fellowship of heroes.

name: Blades in the Dark (1e)
description: The original 'Forged in the Dark' system where players play a crew of scoundrels performing heists in a haunted Victorian-style city.
